review.review_text:
They say it is “The Best in SF” for a reason!

Absolutely the best! The food was excellent. Creative presentations, unique flavors, appropriate portion sizes. Sommelier was super friendly and helpful. Service was top notch from when we entered until the end.

Service was great, but overall, I was not amazed for the price I paid. For the best value, j would recommend the 3 course set and forget about the cheese cart and desert.

There are better value restaurants in terms of price and taste. Obviously everyone has their personal tastes, but there was a huge difference in quality between dishes. A few dishes we got were outstanding (mainly the appetizers), while many were meh and sub-par. 

If you are gonna eat here multiple times, I think you just gotta experitement to find which dishes are the best.

This was our first time to Gary Danko. We ordered 5 courses off the right side of the menu. Andrew was our main server, but everyone pitched in to help. Food was served at just the right pace. My wifes water glass almost got empty, once, and never again. All servers, managers, assistants worked to make this an exceptional experience. Two days before we dined, they retained their Michelin star. We have eaten in other restaurants, the Jules Verne, La Mer, Alan Wongs, and several others and this ranked right up with the best. Food was wonderful. We ate different things so were able to sample each others dishes, and found none of the lacking. Surprises at the end of the meal, were delightful. Again, Andrew and his team were absolutely GREAT!

We went there for our anniversary. Staff was absolutely perfect in any way, at any time. The food is so tasteful and made with passion, that there are no words that could describe it.

They even made us an anniversary cake. Thank you so much!!!

Just one suggestion: The dishes came all very quick, what may be the american way. Think about giving them the time they would deserve. You put so much in them!

This is our second visit to this San Francisco landmark. Our friends are in town from Minnesota and they said this spot is listed as a top 10 restaurant in Trip Advisor and they wanted to go. Danko did not disappoint! 100% legit!!! I had foie in all my courses! Seared, tourchon, and some in the stuffing of my quail. Soufflé dessert was amazing also. Service is worked class top notch. Just bummed my pics didn’t turn out great.

We had the pleasure of eating here tonight. We luckily we got the reservation same day. The restaurant was packed. Staff was amazing. They didn't miss a beat. Each course was to die for.  I couldn't find a thing to criticize if i tried. If you want an amazing meal save up and go to this unforgettable restaurant. You won't regret it!

Gary Danko has been a standout in San Francisco for many years, and it's still necessary to plan two months in advance for a reservation. We had originally planned to go in June for a special occasion, but we had to postpone several times until we finally were able to go. The restaurant reservation staff was most accommodating, part of what makes for an outstanding experience.

The menu offers a wide range of choices from appetizers through dessert, with the meal price based on whether you order three, four, or five items. Three was quite enough for us, especially when you add in the amuse-bouche, bread, and wine. But if this is your once-in-a-lifetime trip to the restaurant, then you should by all means order more. Also, you shouldn't view the menu as constraining you - they gladly accommodated my wife's preferences, and I know from past experience that the kitchen is willing to prepare something not on the menu, at least within reason.

We were very pleased with every aspect of the dinner, and also with our good fortune in finding a street parking space close to the restaurant, thus saving us the $20 valet parking charge, which was better spent in the restaurant. If the weather is OK and you are able to walk, it's definitely worth checking for a space, though you should carefully check the legality of anything that you find, since parking tickets cost as much as the dinner.

We waited too long to return to Gary Danko, and have thus already made a reservation for a date in February, two months from now.

I LOVE Gary Danko! 
I have been 4 times, and every time it is a wonderful experience!
I like variety, so I love the make your own menu feel of choosing what course item is perfect for you that night!
Don't forget that the cheese cart is incredible, so leave some room for cheese, please!
The service never lets you down here, and the balance between attentive and not buggin you is perfect!
The wine list is fantastic and I always enjoy!
Go early, or it can feel loud and more crowded.
Enjoy!

I booked this two months in advance of our trip to San Francisco. We visited on a Thursday night and even 2 months out only had an early sitting available (6pm).

It was romantic with mood lighting and lots of waiters taking care of you.

The menu is a set price for 3, 4 or 5 courses but you get to choose each meal as against a degustation-style menu. The only stipulation was you had to order all courses at the beginning of the meal.

We had the 3 course options and the price was relatively affordable when compared to some degustation meals we've enjoyed.

The food was all very good. My sweet corn soup was extraordinary and my seafood thai curry was gorgeous. The style of presentation came with a bit of theatre which added to the specialness of the night.

My friend's pork dish was a bit mixed, the belly gorgeous but the tenderloin not so.

Desserts were good. I had the triple brûlée which was yum and my wife the three ice cream sandwiches that were also good.

I always enjoy having a sommelier manage the wine and ours did a stellar job recommending wines that suited both our palates and choice of meals. My only disappointment was that for the white wine we were charged by the glass when we had requested a bottle. I thought that strange. It was $20 more expensive that way and also we wondered whether we had an extra glass available.

It was also nice being in a restaurant where everyone was dressed up. Jackets and/or ties were common and ladies wearing lovely dresses. It's rare these days with the casualisation of eateries.

The 2 sittings mean that if you have an early one you won't get to linger over your courses as the large number of waiters sure deliver each course quickly. We were out by 8pm.

We would happily recommend the restaurant and hope to make it back one day when next in SF.

Restaurant Gary Danko –  San Francisco

Synopsis: it is one of top Rated Restaurant in San Francisco - I will recommended to book in advance and you'll be happy you did - OR hit the front door at 5:30pm and enjoy the same dinner in the bar area. Your dining experience will be simply impeccable. 

This is local GEM in San Francisco. Amazing service beyond your imagination - amazing foods beyond your imagination and all worth every cent you spend. 

Venue:

Experience

Excellent place to dine-in we've eaten in a lot of fine dining restaurants around the world and this is one of the best. The food was out of this world. It's was my friend’s birthday the day that we visited and they had made a little cake for her which was a lovely touch. The staffs were very professional and friendly. The only criticism I could make was the tables were rather close together and the fact that there appeared to be only the one unisex toilet, which in a busy restaurant is a little unusual. Overall thought it was a wonderful night.

A neighborhood favorite and my go-to spots for all my fancy out-of-town guests, I truly have never had a bad experience here. They always manage to make their patrons feel extra special. Whether that's addressing you by name, remembering what you ordered or for what special occasion came for, they really do make you feel like you're part of the family.

I loved the extensive wine list from all over the world from the old world reds and whites of Europe to the fruitier new world wine selections of California and beyond, the pairings are just endless. 

Some notable items were the scallops, Moroccan spiced squab, bass, and the cheese cart. If you are there for a special occasion, they will usually bring out a little special dessert for you - happened for my parent's anniversary, a few birthdays, and an engagement party.

Needless to say, you are paying for the quality of the food and the excellence of the service. Nothing gets overlooked here and everything is done with a purpose. 

Price: 250

Best dining experience I've ever had. I've eaten in high end restaurants in Paris, NYC, SF and in between. Doesn't get better than GD imo. Best service ever. Cannot wait to go back for my birthday!
As an aside... Went to Boulevard last week... hated it.

Worst restaurant experience I have ever had! The woman at the front door was rude and arrogant! The manager wasn't any better! I have seen way better decor as well! I have been in the fine dinning business and eaten at some of the best and this is not one of them!This restaurant is over rated and over priced....don't waste you time or money here. San Francisco has much better to offer!

When I think of Gary Danko, I think of 1- the impeccable wait service and 2 - the food - it definitely lived up to the hype. You can do a la cart or choose from 3, 4, or 5 courses and the best part of that you can choose from anything off the menu and they will proportion your meal. Great cheese selections as well. The atmosphere is very relaxed and not snobbish type of fine dining feel. We even got a take home gift. Will be back again.

Absolutely amazing! From the moment you walk in, everything is taken care of and the food is truly exceptional. The best dining experience of my life; food, service, everything was top notch. Not cheap, but if you're looking for a world class restaurant, look no further.
Awesome, Amazing food and service!!!

An amazing experience. We went to Gary Danko's on our fifth anniversary trip to San Francisco (five years ago now!). I'm not a person who is always comfortable in really fancy restaurants, but I wanted to try the amazing food I had heard about, so I made a reservation.

When we first got there, we had to wait quite a bit for our table. They never let us get upset, though, sending us free drinks and little bites "from the chef" that included a wonderful warm salmon on a crisp bread round, topped with caviar. Everyone from the bartender to the waiters, etc., kept walking up to us and apologizing profusely and offering to bring us something else on the house.

They have a wonderful fixed price menu, where you can order the 3-, 4- or 5-course meal and get anything on the menu in it. We got the 5-course for around $90 each (we decided to splurge). My husband and I got something different for each course so we could try each other's food, and they were ALL amazing. One course after another was cooked perfectly and just amazing to taste. They portions were just right for five courses, which, for us, included a dessert and cheese course.

The service was amazing from the first minute we sat down. I never felt uncomfortable or condescended to, as can happen in restaurants of this caliber. I felt comfortable asking questions about what certain items on the menu were, and the waiter knew all of the answers. Quite impressive! I think they were had spy cameras or something, because our empty plates never sat long in front of us, and it was clearly a well-oiled machine working to bring us utensils, etc., for the next course.

At the end of the meal, they brought us a wonderful chocolate dessert with "Happy Anniversary" artfully written on the plate in chocolate. By this time, there weren't many people left eating, but we never felt rushed. After that, the waiter brought us a tray full of little dessert bites, telling us the chef had been experimenting with things and wanted us to try them on the house. We also were plied with muffins, wine bottle openers and other swag on our way out, the different employees *still* apologizing for how long we had to wait. Throughout the night, we were comped all of our drinks and quite a bit of food in what seemed an attempt to make up for our having to wait what, at most, was a half-hour wait. And hey, it worked! We were thrilled with our overall experience, and we have told everyone we know going out to San Francisco since then.

The scallop course is the best course I have ever eaten, period. All of the other courses, while good, are probably not worth the price of a dinner. You do get fantastic service, probably the best service I have experienced. Plus, the size of their portions are more than enough to ensure that you do not leave hungry.
Gustatory. Boy did we get lucky. Table for two on two hours notice. Exquisite meal and memorable wine pairing. Got a signed menu.
We were in SF so we went. this place came highly recommended by friends. they did not disappoint. everything was just special. we'll surely be back nect time we are in SF.

Wonderful Evening. Very expensive and worth every penny. The Lobster Risotto was to die for. Impecable service, warm and friendly yet very professional. Will go back next time we are in beautiful San Francisco.

Worth every calorie and penny! We couldn't get a reservation until 10 pm on the 1 night we were in SF, so we went at 5:30 and got seats at the bar. They serve the same menu there and the waiter/bartender was fantastic. The food was incredible, I will dream of the glazed oysters for a long time. My husband and I agreed that this was among the best meals we have ever eaten (and we love food and eat out regularly). The next time I know I'll be in SF, I'll be sure to get a table well in advance. Can't wait!

Amazing. We were only in SF for 4 days. Foodie friends of ours said it was too bad we wouldn't get to go here but we pulled offa miracle and squeezed in - at 10:30pm on a Wednesday.

It was worth it. Truly, one of the best meals I have ever had. I had a gastric bypass a few years ago and, as a result, my pace for eating is slower than most. Either that, or I can manager about 2 bites which I was NOT going to do here! They served us nice and slow as we were ready. They were exceptional with handing my shellfish allergy even to the point of getting us new amuse-bouche that didn't include caviar! 
The corn chowder was one of the best things I have ever eaten in my entire life and worth the price of admission alone. The itty bitty biscuit and the way it fairly melted into the steaming milk...the stuff of gourmet dreams! 
The service was impeccable even though we were the last folks there. Lovely people, amazing food. Money be damned - this is worth every penny.

Dissappointing. My boyfriend and I went to Gary Danko to celebrate our 10 years anniversary. It was a big night out for us and we chose this restaurant based on all the great reviews. First of all the, atmosphere was very dated, but we were completely willing to overlook this as we were really just there for the food. The service was very good (but certainly not the best around). The food was all clearly made of high quality ingredients but the flavors were not very well integrated. Each component of each dish was kept separate (I think for the sake of presentation) which left me trying to compose my own mini dish for each bite. Even then I thought most dishes were lacking in creativity and flavor. I have had much better meals in San francisco for a fraction of the price. I will give them this, I have a number of food sensivities and the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful in identifying items to avoid or making a minor modification if possible.

Warm and Sexy. An outstanding experience!! Ambiance is warm and sexy with a professional and friendly staff. There is a reason why it takes 3-4 weeks to get a reservation. We booked about 3 weeks in advance and were only able to get a 10 pm dinner reservation. So book well in advance if you have something special coming up and want to make the date.

Food was as flavorful as it was well crafted. You could not ask for a better dining experience. Pork, duck, lobster and soft shell crab were all wonderful. Portion sizes are nice and you will not go hungry. Cherry and chocolate soufflés were delicious. 

Cheese selections were excellent, you know it's going to be a good dinner when you find out they have a well-stocked cheese cart!!! I am a Foie Gras fiend always looking for my next best Foie Gras experience! GD did not disappoint me! It was delicious, not to thick just right.

Wine list is well rounded and covers a selection that will please all; price range is on the high side. Sommelier Jeff Anderson was excellent, engaging and knowledgeable. I so look forward to my next dinner at GD.

user.name: Diary Of A Foodie By Liz
user.template_text: Diary Of A Foodie By Liz

review.review_text: Don't miss this one.... Plan ahead as reservations are tough to come by, but the food is outstanding, service is good, and the wine list is incrediable.
Amazing food. Service is like no other place you've ever been. They treat you like royalty. You won't be disappointed.
Top notch service. good food; but too rich.
Unforgetable!. Gary Danko is simply the best!

Although it can be tough to get a reservation, if you are willing to eat at the bar, you can arrive shortly before the doors open at 5pm to stand in line for first-come-first-served seating. Service by bartender Dave was outstanding. Recommend the oysters w/ osetra caviar. Guys: dinner jacket not required, but worn by most guys there.
So good! We got a table the same day (we got lucky) so we ate late ... But worth the wait! We both had the 5 couse tasting menu and left very happy and satisfied .. I'll go back when in San Fran

Best Restaurant I've ever been to!!. I am still thinking about this place--we ate here last night for our anniversary and everything about it lived up to the hype. I can honestly say I was excited about each course; everything sounded so appetizing and creative. The food was unreal-- but the experience was just as fantastic. It was a whole sensory adventure from the ambiance to the presentation to the aroma and then of course, the flavor. The service has to be the best service of any restaurant I have ever been to, and there is an attention to detail that is rare. I felt like a celebrity getting special treatment, but I know they treat everyone that way. In New York, we ate at Gramercy Tavern which was about the same price ($250 for two, including tip) but we were so disappointed about the experience after our expectations were set so high (we'd heard a lot about it when we visited). No meal can even hold a candle to the night at Gary Danko. GO THERE!

TastyTwosome's Review of Gary Danko. Break from my little adventures to take you into a...

degustation of desire.

4.5 stars.

To start, an amuse bouche of carrot ginger soup, a hint of creme fraiche, rich curry, and littered with perfect mushroom cubes. Garnished with parsley.

Next, pan seared sonoma valley foie gras, firm and plump sittting atop a compote of caramelized red onions, and rhubarb softened in... red onions...perhaps? Garnished with beautiful flowing greens.

Mushroom dusted sea scallops with english pea puree, shimeji mushrooms, and meyer lemon. The scallops are fat and juicy, tender with sinking meat, and in a subtle, but beautiful, pea puree.

Quail stuffed foie gras, leeks and quinoa, garro, maitake mushrooms, zucchini and roasted red peppers nestled in a compilation of quinoa and maitake mushrooms and roasted red peppers. Zucchini curls garnish the plate and add coolness.

The pace of the meal is quick, fast and good. The tempo picks up as the dishes grow richer, and spanish guitar quietly spinning through the air.

Lemongrass soda, housemade jalapeno syrup, muddles with basil, makes a light and spicy refreshing drink between the meat course and the fromage.

Picandine pico affine, petit agur, la demon du midi, la vigneron with red grapes and raisin bread

Dessert, French earl grey macaroon with milk choice cream caramel sauce, lemon cream cheese ice cream huckleberry

Chocoate with coffee ice cream chocolate sauce

Mignardise to end.

voila. seduced you are. :)

video reviews of degustations on my site http://www.tastytwosom... :) enjoy.

Tracy aka @tastytwosome on twitter. :)
Stop reading reviews. Just go there! You will NOT be disappointed!

I graduated culinary school several years ago and was taught the concept of perfect service and excellent food. Gary Danko is the only restaurant I've found that meets and exceeds the true definition.
Gary Danko. The food is great and the service is wonderful. I have never had a bad meal there. The wine selection is also wonderful.
Awesome place

Great Even At The Bar. I am in agreement that it frankly doesn't get any better than the dining experience at Restaurant Gary Danko.  My wife and I ate at the bar and had one of the most incredible dining experiences ever.  Just wait 'til we get to sit at a table.

A Little Piece of Heaven.... ...on earth. Gary Danko's restaurant is about as close to perfect as you can get. From calling to make reservations, to the greetings upon arrival, through the service throughout the meal to the departure...every detail receives attention. I can't think of anything to improve. On my first visit, I pretty much expected the food to be perfectly prepared and expertly presented...it was. My dining companion had a gluten allergy, which was handled sensitively and without fuss, everything was a matter of course.My big surprise came when I departed...they had sent for my car when the presented the bill...the valet had it waiting for me when I left. What a pleasant surprise! Don't omit the cheese course...it was exquisite.
Amazing food, amazing service. Gary Danko really knows how to do his stuff. And the staff really know how to take care of their customers.
